title: Merz Says Germany Will Step Up Ukraine Weapons Support as Zelensky Visits
content: In the latest sign of a warming relationship, President Volodymyr Zelensky met in Berlin with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, who said Germany would increase funding for arms production and supplies.

title: Haiti Enlists Blackwater Founder and Trump Ally to Take on Criminal Gangs
content: The Haitian government has signed a contract with Mr. Prince, the private military contractor who founded Blackwater, a company notorious for a civilian massacre in Iraq.

title: Israel Strikes Yemen’s Main Airport Again After Houthi Attacks
content: Israel said the bombing of the airport, which was targeted for the second time this month, had destroyed the last plane used by the Iran-backed Houthi militia.

title: Joël Le Scouarnec, French Doctor Who Molested Hundreds of Children, Is Sentenced
content: A former surgeon had confessed to abusing at least 299 people, mostly children, in what is considered the largest case of its kind in French history.

title: Crime Rings Plotted to Trade Cocaine for Syrian Weapons, Prosecutors Say
content: The intricate scheme, spanning four continents, appears to justify concerns that the military arsenal of Bashar al-Assad, the deposed Syrian dictator, could fall into dangerous hands.

title: What to Know About Israel’s Renewed Ground Offensive in Gaza
content: The military has been slowly advancing in the territory since the government declared a renewed ground operation. The campaign has drawn criticism from some allies.

title: Stalin’s Image Returns to Moscow’s Subway, Honoring a Brutal History
content: The Kremlin has increasingly embraced the Soviet dictator and his legacy, using them to exalt Russian history in a time of war, but he remains a deeply divisive figure in Russia.

title: U.N. Condemns Israel’s New Aid Program in Gaza, After Chaotic Start
content: The new operation is intended to bypass both the United Nations and Hamas, but aid groups say even if it works as intended, it is dangerously inadequate.

title: Congo’s Former President Returns Home, Accused of Treason
content: Joseph Kabila was accused of supporting the Rwanda-backed militia M23. Days later he arrived in Goma, a city held by the militia, so he remains out of prosecutors’ reach.

title: What to Know About the Liverpool FC Parade Car Crash
content: Almost 80 people, including four children, were injured on Monday after a driver plowed into a crowd that had been celebrating Liverpool F.C.’s Premier League title.

title: Israeli Forces Said They Killed a ‘Terrorist.’ He Was 14 Years Old.
content: The death of Amer Rabee, a Palestinian American in the West Bank, has spurred anger over soldiers’ use of force and an apparent lack of accountability.

title: French Crypto Chiefs Step Up Security After Violent Kidnappings
content: ​Big players in the crypto sector argue that new European cryptocurrency rules may be enabling recent abductions and are demanding changes and more security.

title: Mediators Urge Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal as Israeli Offensive Looms
content: Israel, Hamas and the Trump administration have issued different messages about where efforts to reach a truce stand.

title: Police Quickly Gave Details on Liverpool Car Ramming, Aiming to Prevent Rumors
content: Just hours after the episode, the police announced that the driver was a white British man. After previous violence, false anti-Muslim speculation had been spread online.

title: Japan Welcomes a New Sumo Champ. Surprise: He’s Japanese.
content: Onosato Daiki became the first Japanese man in eight years to be named a yokozuna, or grand champion, the highest title in the sport.

title: Turkey Cracks Down on Fliers Who Stand Up Too Soon, Threatening Fines
content: As of this month, passengers who stand before planes fully stop may be fined by the Turkish government.

title: Wednesday Briefing: Chaos at a Gaza Aid Site
content: Plus, climbing Mount Everest with a performance enhancer.

title: As Trump Seeks Iran Deal, Israel Again Raises Possible Strikes on Nuclear Sites
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, wary of a diplomatic solution to curbing Iran’s nuclear program, continues to press for military action that would upend President Trump’s push for a negotiated deal.

title: Wednesday Briefing: Chaos at a Gaza Aid Site
content: Plus, climbing Mount Everest with a performance enhancer.

title: Chaos Erupts at Israeli-Backed Aid Distribution Site in Gaza
content: Starvation looming, desperate Palestinians surged toward an aid center that Israel says was designed to circumvent Hamas.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Drive a Rise in Trade Crime
content: President Trump’s steep global tariffs have supercharged efforts to evade them. Some U.S. companies say the government is ill equipped to keep up.

title: King Charles Warns Canada’s Parliament of a ‘Dangerous and Uncertain’ World
content: The king was invited to open Canada’s Parliament as a subtle rebuke to President Trump’s economic and annexation threats against Canada.

title: In a Medieval Greek Fortress, Residents Feud Over ‘Pharaonic’ Cable Car Plan
content: The authorities in Monemvasia, founded in the sixth century, say people with limited mobility need access to the town’s peak. But critics say the project would destroy the identity of the site.

title: Zelensky Is Expected in Berlin as Merz Steps Forward as Key Backer of Ukraine
content: A likely focus of talks between the two leaders will be military aid and whether Germany will provide Ukraine with the Taurus cruise missile.

title: How the Liverpool Parade Car Crash Unfolded
content: The driver of a car that plowed into a crowd, injuring 65 people, was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and driving while under the influence of drugs, British police said.

title: How to Hide a 350-Foot Megayacht
content: Russian oligarchs use the offshore system to shield their luxury assets. The Trump administration is ending an effort to find and seize them.

title: Caught Between Russia and the U.S., Germany Aims to Be a Stronger Force in NATO
content: As Germany’s new chancellor increases military spending, he has presided over the activation of a German tank brigade based in Lithuania and raised alarms about the threat from Russia.

title: They Inhaled a Gas and Scaled Everest in Days. Is It the Future of Mountaineering?
content: A group of British men went from London to the summit of Everest and back in less than a week with the help of xenon gas. Mountaineers and the Nepalese government weren’t pleased.

title: Satellite Images Suggest a Russian Plan to Restart Seized Ukrainian Nuclear Plant
content: Snaking power lines are part of Moscow’s goal to harness the power of the Zaporizhzhia facility, according to Greenpeace.

title: Could the French Pedophile Doctor Joël Le Scouarnec Have Been Stopped Earlier?
content: Years before Joël Le Scouarnec was charged with abusing 299 former patients, he was convicted of downloading child sexual abuse imagery.

title: Why a Venezuelan Mother and Her Children Fled the US
content: Yessica Rojas, a Venezuelan mother, risked everything to seek a better future for her two children in the United States. This spring, they left Missouri because she feared losing them.

title: In Nashville, Volunteers Are Figuring Out How to Counter ICE
content: In early May, Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents were spotted alongside Tennessee State Highway Patrol troopers in areas of Nashville.

title: ICE Agents and State Troopers Team Up in Nashville Operation
content: In early May, Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents were spotted alongside Tennessee State Highway Patrol troopers in areas of Nashville, partnering up for a weeklong operation that turned routine traffic stops into immigration arrests.

title: How North Korea Botched Its Warship Launch
content: Satellite images and videos show how launching a 5,000-ton warship into the water sideways can cause it to capsize if done incorrectly.

title: Tuesday Briefing: U.S. and E.U. Talk Trade
content: Plus, redefining Sweden’s culture.

title: A Science Fiction Writer Wrestles With China’s Rise, and His Own Decline
content: In his stories, Han Song explores the disorientation accompanying China’s modernization, sometimes writing of unthinkable things that later came true.

title: Tuesday Briefing: U.S. and E.U. Talk Trade
content: Plus, defining Sweden’s culture.

title: Liverpool FC Victory Parade: Driver Plows Into Crowd, Injuring 47
content: The driver, a 53-year-old British man, was arrested, but the event was not being treated as terrorism, the police said. Prime Minister Keir Starmer described the scenes as “appalling.”

title: What to Know About the Deportees the Trump Administration Wants to Send to South Sudan
content: The Trump administration has asked the Supreme Court to approve speedy deportations. Experts say the policy may be trying to shape the behavior of immigrants through fear.

title: Sebastian Kurz, ex-Chancellor of Austria, Cleared of Perjury Charges
content: Sebastian Kurz, who became Austria’s youngest chancellor when he took office in December 2017 at 31, led two troubled governments.

title: Macron Plays Down Video of Shove From Wife: ‘It’s Nonsense’
content: The French president, Emmanuel Macron, was pushed in the face as he left a plane in Vietnam. The bigger issue, he said, was the reaction, part of a string of disinformation by “crazy people.”

title: Europe Secured a Tariff Delay From Trump, but Can It Now Make a Deal?
content: Officials from the European Union and the United States will start a new negotiating push, after President Trump delayed until July 9 tariffs of 50 percent.

title: How a Booker Prize-Winning Work From India Redefined Translation
content: An extraordinary author-translator collaboration produced a book, “Heart Lamp,” that was lauded for enriching the English language.

title: Trump’s Comments on Gaza Reflect Israel’s Growing Isolation
content: For months, Israel’s strongest allies had been reluctant to join a wave of global censure against the war. Now, even the Trump administration appears to be growing impatient.

title: Russia Intensifies Attacks on Ukraine as U.S. Steps Back
content: With diplomatic efforts to reach a cease-fire appearing remote, and President Trump apparently abandoning the process, Russia has been escalating its assaults on Ukrainian cities and on the battlefield.

title: King Charles III Visits Canada as Trump Threatens Its Sovereignty: What to Know
content: The British monarch, who is Canada’s official head of state, is coming at a moment when President Trump has threatened the country’s sovereignty.

title: NATO Wants a Cordial Summit, but Trump or Zelensky Could Disrupt It
content: NATO’s leader is looking for little drama and a focus on new spending goals, not disagreements over Ukraine.

title: Trump’s Immigration Policies Push Venezuelan Migrants to Risk ‘Self-Deportation’
content: Thousands of Venezuelan migrants are doing just what U.S. leaders want them to. But to get home, they face as many dangers as on the journey north.

title: What’s Trump’s Vision on China, Russia and the World?
content: President Trump’s recent actions and statements suggest he might want an arrangement where the United States, China and Russia each dominate their sphere of influence.

title: Bari, Italy, Transformed Its Identity. Here Come the Tourists.
content: Foreigners — and residents — long avoided Bari’s old town, which had been plagued by mob crime. Now, with direct flights from the U.S. starting, residents are excited, but wary.

title: US Archaeologists Face Uncertain Future With Trump Administration Cuts
content: Federal layoffs and grant terminations threaten efforts to understand and preserve the nation’s past. “We are getting cut off at the knees,” said one archaeologist.

title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation Head, Jake Wood, Resigns
content: Jake Wood quit the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, saying it was “not possible” to implement a new Israeli-backed aid system in the enclave while remaining neutral and independent.

title: Venezuela’s Government Claims Victory in Polls Boycotted by Opposition Leader
content: Polling places in Caracas, the capital, and other cities were sparsely populated but officials claimed turnout was higher than 40 percent.

title: Monday Briefing: Trump Delayed E.U. Tariffs
content: Plus, Mexico City’s artistic eras.

title: As South Korea Gets Ready to Vote, Women Don’t Like the Choices
content: Women took the lead in the protests against South Korea’s last president. But the men running to replace him are saying little about the discrimination they face.

title: Monday Briefing: Russia Bombards Ukraine
content: Plus, Mexico City’s artistic eras.

title: A Quiet Funeral in Israel for Victim of Washington Shooting
content: Yaron Lischinsky, 30, was buried on Sunday in the small town where his family lived.
